I can provide some specific examples of policies rommel was critical of:

1. persecution of jews: rommel was opposed to the persecution of jews and was known to have said that the treatment of jews in germany was a disgrace.

2. forced labor: rommel protested against the use of forced labor in the war effort, particularly the use of prisoners of war and slave laborers. he believed that it was contrary to the principles of chivalry and honor.

3. military strategy: rommel was critical of some of hitler's military strategies, in particular, his decision to invade the soviet union. rommel believed that it was a mistake to engage in a two-front war and that the german military should focus on securing the western front.

4. treatment of occupied territories: rommel was also critical of the harsh treatment of occupied territories, particularly in north africa. he believed that the german military should adopt a more humane approach and work to win over the support of the local population.

despite his criticisms, it is important to note that rommel remained loyal to hitler and the nazi party until his death.
